Come intern with one of the largest electrical engineering companies in the world.

Come Intern with our Programmable Solutions Group (PSG).

You will work on some aspect of the Intel Quartus compile system.

Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Are an effective communicator
Are well organized, with good time management skills
Are able to work independently

Transform complex data sets into meaningful conclusions and recommendations
Participate in developing completely new and innovative solutions, using machine learning, AI and statistical approaches
Get experience working with different types of data including telematics, text data and image data

Bachelor's, Master's or PhD in progress, in artificial intelligence, data science, computer science, mathematics, statistics or a related field

Practical experience with Python or R programming languages

Cloud Academy

Java Developer Academy

DevOps
Developer (.Net)
Java Developers

Fast track your professional development to become a top consultant

Undergraduate/Graduate Mitacs Internship, Myant Response to COVID-19 Pandemic
Myant Response To COVID-19 Pandemic – Research and Technology Development for Smart Textile Solutions builds The Myant Skiin Connected Life App. It is a collaborative family informatics application which connects seniors, other family members, friends, and caregivers, to enable health and wellness related data sharing and support. Skiin differs from other products as it is based on Myant’s highly accurate intelligent textiles garments which collect activity and related biomechanical data through knitted sensors on the garment. Data are then transferred from the garment pod to the mobile Skiin app via Bluetooth. Our design seeks to deliver seamless human-computer interaction through effective data presentation, visualization, and tool tips. Data visualization is one of the core strategies that health and wellness applications use to allow individuals to manage, analyze and share their data, including for senior users. We are researching all aspects of design from visualization to user interaction to the programming needed for implementation and to add a predictive capacity, for example with heart health. This phase of the project focuses on software engineering to complete the Skiin prototype, take it to market, evaluate outcomes and improve Skiin.
Responsibilities:
With the assistance of a senior/lead developer they will research and translate product requirements into reliable, maintainable, and scalable code.
Interns will work closely with Myant UX, hardware, and data science teams to transform innovative technology into groundbreaking products.
The intern will support software research and build the next generation of user experience, linking the mobile platform built in native Android and iOS code to the Bluetooth enabled wearable clothing pod and smart textile garments.
Research and implement an interface with Bluetooth Low Energy sensors and web-based APIs, as part of Myant’s massively distributed wearable IoT platform.
Working closely with Myant UX designers, they will implement intuitive UIs.
They will research and implement an interface with Bluetooth Low Energy sensors and web-based APIs, as part of Myant’s massively distributed wearable IoT platform
They will rapidly prototype under an agile, test-driven development environment, hence learning about industry-standing rapid prototyping.
They will strengthen their ability to diagnose and fix bugs and performance bottlenecks for performance in Agile framework.
Qualifications:
Current enrolment in a relevant undergraduate or graduate degree at OCAD University
Capacity in JavaScript, Java, and Swift programming languages.
Experience in implementing Native Android and iOS code.
Knowledge of UX design.
Data visualization skills an asset.
Interest in wearable technology.
Ability to self-teach new software, ideas, concepts, plug-ins, etc, as required for projects.
Ability to complete multiple tasks and manage any unforeseen issues.
Self-motivated.
Strong communications skills
Able to write up findings.
Hours of Work: 20 hours per week
Work Environment: On-line and 205 Richmond St W, 7th floor, Toronto, Ontario Visual Analytics Lab when the University reopens, and at Myant, Etobicoke.
Compensation: $3670 for approximately 2.5 months

Building data pipelines based on modern IT architectures (batch & streaming) – configure extract/transform/load software and rules engines;
Image recognition and natural language processing to capture data from unstructured data including image, text, and handwriting;
Adapting and customizing machine learning and natural language processing to execute core data ingestion and transformation tasks (translations, validations, exception detection);
Continuous integration / continuous deployment workflows and cloud deployment (DevOps);
Support with the development of Python based applications and predictive models deployed as RESTful microservices;
Expand the team’s use of cloud computing software by prototyping new software as service (SaaS) or platform as service (PaaS) capabilities;
Participate in various research projects in the field of statistics, machine learning, and deep learning – collaborating with our greater team of scientists and engineers.

Currently pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Information Technology, Engineering (Computer, Software, Physics, Bioinformatics) – or equivalent program offering coursework working with large datasets;
Experience working with any of the following: Python, Flask, SQL, API or web development, Hadoop and Distributed Computing;
Familiarity developing software or analyzing large datasets;
Solid communication skills; spoken & written, formal/informal presentation.

Graduate Mitacs Internship, Applying Generative Design to Complete Community Planning
Applying Generative Design to Complete Community Planning brings together growing computational practices in generative design with the urban design challenge of planning and building complete communities. The concept of complete communities is in part inspired by new urbanism which focuses on human and environmental needs. Transportation modes within a community and the network of access that connect complete communities are critical for their design and success. Transportation modes within a community and the network of access that connect complete communities are critical for their design and success. We will use generative design to explore the definition and design of complete communities, both de novo and as an evolution of existing communities. The research will focus on developing feasible neighbourhood designs that lead to higher-density, diverse, and vibrant communities that reduce the need to travel and provide effective options for residual travel demand and nearby services. Research will result in innovations in transportation and urban planning, design practice, in efficiencies in planning, and expansion of the Autodesk suite into large-scale urban planning.
The project is supervised by Dr. Sara Diamond in collaboration with Autodesk as the industrial partner. Autodesk has successfully used “generative design” to tackle design problems in the automotive, aerospace, construction, building information management and consumer goods industries. The computational capacities of Autodesk’s generative design will allow data sets relevant to the complete community planning process to be analyzed and multiple scenarios created which can be tested, iterated, validated, and implemented. The challenges of designing complete communities can be addressed from a variety of constraints (principles, zoning regulations and land use guidelines, community mix, building codes, or financial constraints) with amplified consultation from multiple stakeholders. Case studies will provide contemporary challenges and data. OCAD U continue to build its research capacity in geo-spatial visualization the context of the Autodesk platform. It will train an interdisciplinary intern who is a current GTHA university student who bridges urban planning and digital media/ICT. Preference will be given to OCAD U enrolled students.
Responsibilities:
Undertake literature and policy review to establish metrics that will be used to evaluate a complete community.
Collect community data that can inform the metrics and the generative model and the evaluative component. Engage with stakeholders with faculty leader and advisory team to establish and narrow the metrics. Validate metrics with stakeholders.
Undertake site visits to understand the environment and generic design challenges and engage with stakeholders.
Collect relevant data.
Evaluate candidate complete community designs in an actual case study against various criteria for complete communities such as A Place to Grow, and stakeholder consultations.
Establish metrics, summarize the metrics and their weightings undertake data collection and validation. Build the metrics that describe the objectives or goals of the design problem.
Analyze if and how existing policies, regulations and requirements limit or support the quality of the complete community designs suggested through a generative design process.
Create a prototype that tests metrics for an agreed upon sub-neighbourhood of the case study through a generative geometry model that deﬁnes a ‘design space’ of possible design solutions using computational and visualization strategies and represents trade-offs.
Apply a metaheuristic search algorithm such as a genetic algorithm to search through the design space and ﬁnd a variety of high-performing design options based on the stated objectives.
Use urban scale geometry and spatial analysis to create models and prototypes.
Refine visualization strategies to communicate metrics and related designs.
Use Revit tools to complete fully rendered design visualization for consideration by stakeholders.
Present options to stakeholders. Indicate the trade-offs inherent in reconciling the design constraints with the policy goals and residents’ willingness to live in complete communities and definitions of a complete community.
Create plans for a generative design model of the complete community.
Contribute to consideration of the workflow of an urban design project from a systems perspective, (land use, infrastructure planning, building functions and services, building massing, street characteristics, landscape and public space, amenities etc. with transportation planning, both civilian and freight) to ensure that all systems work together.
Contribute findings to the development of a generalized scorecard for complete communities that is a goal of the four-year iCity2.0 project.

Current fulltime enrolment in a relevant graduate degree at OCAD University - Non-students are ineligible.
Able to undertake site visits at collaborative industry partner and complete community development.
Demonstrated skills in literature review and analysis.
Understanding of and skill in data collection, organization, and analysis.
Experienced user of Autodesk tools and facility with Revit.
Preferred experience with Autodesk Dynamo.
Experience in use and design of genetic algorithms or parallel computer science experience.
Knowledge and experience in any of the following: architecture, urban planning, landscape architecture, transportation planning

Graduate Mitacs Internship, Applying Generative Design to Complete Community Planning
Applying Generative Design to Complete Community Planning brings together growing computational practices in generative design with the urban design challenge of planning and building complete communities. The concept of complete communities is in part inspired by new urbanism which focuses on human and environmental needs. Transportation modes within a community and the network of access that connect complete communities are critical for their design and success. Transportation modes within a community and the network of access that connect complete communities are critical for their design and success. We will use generative design to explore the definition and design of complete communities, both de novo and as an evolution of existing communities. The research will focus on developing feasible neighbourhood designs that lead to higher-density, diverse, and vibrant communities that reduce the need to travel and provide effective options for residual travel demand and nearby services. Research will result in innovations in transportation and urban planning, design practice, in efficiencies in planning, and expansion of the Autodesk suite into large-scale urban planning.
The project is supervised by Dr. Sara Diamond in collaboration with Autodesk as the industrial partner. Autodesk has successfully used “generative design” to tackle design problems in the automotive, aerospace, construction, building information management and consumer goods industries. The computational capacities of Autodesk’s generative design will allow data sets relevant to the complete community planning process to be analyzed and multiple scenarios created which can be tested, iterated, validated, and implemented. The challenges of designing complete communities can be addressed from a variety of constraints (principles, zoning regulations and land use guidelines, community mix, building codes, or financial constraints) with amplified consultation from multiple stakeholders. Case studies will provide contemporary challenges and data. OCAD U continue to build its research capacity in geo-spatial visualization the context of the Autodesk platform. It will train an interdisciplinary intern who is a current GTHA university student who bridges urban planning and digital media/ICT. Preference will be given to OCAD U enrolled students.
Responsibilities:
Undertake literature and policy review to establish metrics that will be used to evaluate a complete community.
Collect community data that can inform the metrics and the generative model and the evaluative component. Engage with stakeholders with faculty leader and advisory team to establish and narrow the metrics. Validate metrics with stakeholders.
Undertake site visits to understand the environment and generic design challenges and engage with stakeholders.
Collect relevant data.
Evaluate candidate complete community designs in an actual case study against various criteria for complete communities such as A Place to Grow, and stakeholder consultations.
Establish metrics, summarize the metrics and their weightings undertake data collection and validation. Build the metrics that describe the objectives or goals of the design problem.
Analyze if and how existing policies, regulations and requirements limit or support the quality of the complete community designs suggested through a generative design process.
Create a prototype that tests metrics for an agreed upon sub-neighbourhood of the case study through a generative geometry model that deﬁnes a ‘design space’ of possible design solutions using computational and visualization strategies and represents trade-offs.
Apply a metaheuristic search algorithm such as a genetic algorithm to search through the design space and ﬁnd a variety of high-performing design options based on the stated objectives.
Use urban scale geometry and spatial analysis to create models and prototypes.

At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we’re revolutionizing how Canadians communicate.

If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values bold ideas, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.

Bell’s Field Services team is proud to be the face of the Bell brand, performing the best installation and repair services and maintaining Bell’s network for our residential and business customers.

If you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team.
Using innovative operational theory, tools and techniques, the Field Services team ensures that the right technician with the right skill set arrives at our residential and business customer’s premises on time, every time. We are committed to ensure that Bell's network, products and services are of the highest standard. The Field Services team thrives on providing installation and repair services for business and residential customers using the latest technology, including Fibre, Optical Ethernet, and IPVPN.

Are you looking for a fun and amazing career opportunity next summer? One that provides you with advanced eligibility to join our best-in-class Field Services Graduate Leadership Program upon graduation?

We are looking for talented and enthusiastic individuals to join our Field Services Business Intelligence team next summer. As a Business Intelligence Analytics Developer, you will be working with vast datasets from the entire customer experience value chain to uncover new insights and identify opportunities to provide an even better customer experience. If you are passionate about operational excellence and providing a great customer experience, then the Field Services Operations BI team is the place for you.

The Field Services Business Intelligence team is responsible for developing, maintaining and using data to drive insights to improve customer experience and field technician’s productivity. The team consists of business analysts for analyzing data, developers for sourcing and maintaining data, and programmers for data visualization, ELT activities and AI model development. Throughout your internship you will have the opportunity to work with these teams, amongst many others, to support our Field Services team members with impactful insights and solutions that help us continue to transform the business

Big Data is a Big Deal:
If you're the type of person that has a strong sense of curiosity and is energized by solving complex puzzles, then this role is the perfect opportunity to strengthen your analytical skills. With nearly limitless sources of data at our fingertips, the Field Services Operations Business Intelligence team collects and analyzes data on network and product performance, uses data such as GPS to optimize resource utilization across a workforce of nearly 10,000 people and develops tools to facilitate and elevate the technician and field management teams. The teams findings help prioritize key technology investments and ensures major strategic decisions are always data driven. This is a terrific opportunity to build your project management skills and gain experience working with new, cutting-edge BI technologies.

How the Program Works:
This is a three month structured program where you will be working in teams to tackle your assigned consulting project. All projects are designed to maximize your learnings across various facets of Field Operations, and to provide you with opportunity to network and connect not only with grad peers, but also with the Bell Executive Leadership team. You will be working closely with our operational teams to understand the business and working with large sets of data in Hadoop, SAS/SQL and/or python to present a comprehensive and data-driven solution/suggestion that addresses the business need behind your teams’ project.

Why Join the Program:
Benefit from extensive training and ongoing support from Bell leaders and Executives
Interact with an amazing peer-to-peer grad and alumni support network
Foster programming skills in Python with opportunities to explore ML modelling
Manipulate large complex datasets in Hadoop and/or SQL to identify new insights
Unique opportunity to present your project to the Bell Executive Leadership team
Advanced opportunity to join our best-in-class Graduate Leadership Program upon graduation
Opportunity to develop your analytical, problem-solving and leadership skills with real, customer-facing challenges

What our Interns are Saying:
“What I enjoyed most about my 3 months at Bell was the variety of experiences offered in a short span of time. From gaining firsthand knowledge about front line work to helping solve a real-life business problem, I was able to interact with and learn from people in numerous roles and departments.”
“The best part of the summer was the autonomy offered to interns which allowed us to put academic and on-the-job knowledge to work on our project - it was challenging but very rewarding.”

What we’re Looking for:
Successful students working towards a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Operations Research or Mathematics with a planned graduation date of spring 2023
Highly analytical with an understanding of the basic principles of working with large and complex data sets
Experience with querying languages such as SQL
Experience with software development/programming languages such as Python
Ability to leverage insights and opportunities from data and metrics to build strategies and make recommendations
Demonstrated initiative, leadership and a passion for learning new skills
Strong work ethic and persistence in the face of challenges and opportunities
Demonstrated curiosity and ability to learn quickly, with an ability to manage multiple projects and priorities
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written)
Bilingual (English/French) is an asset

Internship term: May to August 2022
Competitive compensation
Job Location: Montréal or Toronto
Successful participation in this program will provide you with advanced eligibility to join our best in class Graduate Leadership Program resulting in a permanent position with Bell upon your graduation

Bilingualism is an asset (English and French); adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.

Position Overview

SideFX is currently looking for an intern with strong computer animation and VFX skills to assist with skill development in the Houdini community. In this position, you can expect to deepen your knowledge of high-end computer animation and visual effects for use in Film, Television or Gamedev, while working with impassioned, talented colleagues who are proud to create industry-leading 3D computer graphics technology for top studios from around the world.

Note: In order to keep all of our employees and candidates safe during the COVID-19 pandemic, SideFX is hiring and onboarding remotely. Candidates must be eligible and willing to work in Toronto, Canada once pandemic restrictions are lifted, and SideFX deems it's safe to return to the office. In the meantime, remote locations permitted for this role include Ontario, British Columbia and Quebec in Canada – and California, Oklahoma, Texas, New York, Arizona, Kansas and Florida in the United States.

Key Duties & Responsibilities*

As part of the SideFX marketing team, you will be responsible for:

Contributing to SideFX’s goals for building skills in the marketplace
Developing visually appealing artwork that can be used in learning materials
Documenting the workflows used to create the artwork
Sharing this knowledge through videos, tutorials and sample files
Developing content which aligns with marketing goals and objectives
Communicating effectively with the team at all stages of the production process using storyboards, animatics and dailies

You may also be asked to:

Assist in hands-on training
Participate in educational presentations at online events or trade shows
Help support key customers
Other duties as assigned

Adjustments will be made to enable duties & responsibilities to be met working remotely considering the current Covid-19 pandemic situation.

Requirements

You have 2-4 years experience using Houdini in school projects
You have a portfolio of work which demonstrates an accomplished set of Houdini skills and a strong visual aesthetic
Good communication skills, including writing, verbal and graphic/visual, and excellent attention to detail
You are a highly motivated self-starter, who is comfortable organizing and working with little supervision while meeting deadlines.

Bonus Skills
You have created and published online tutorials either written or video-based
You have a working knowledge of Adobe’s Creative Suite including Indesign, Illustrator, Photoshop and Premiere video editing software
You have a working knowledge of other CG applications such as Unreal Engine, Unity, Substance Designer, Autodesk Maya or 3ds Max

We appreciate interest from all candidates, but only those with previous Houdini experience will be considered.

To apply for this role you will have to provide examples of past work, including breakdowns explaining how Houdini was used, when applying.

Company Profile

For over thirty years, SideFX has been providing artists with procedural 3D animation and visual effects tools designed to create the highest-quality cinematic results. We are passionate about what our customers do because our roots are in production, both as artists and as pioneering technical innovators.

SideFX has been recognized by the Academy of Motion Pictures, Arts and Science multiple times - including with an Oscar® - for the development of our Houdini software, and its breakthrough procedural-based technology.

Houdini is used by the world’s top film, TV, and game studios to create blockbuster movies like Spider-Man, The Lion King and Godzilla vs. Kong, TV shows like The Crown, Game of Thrones and S.W.A.T., and video games like Ghost Recon, Far Cry and Age of Empires. Our customers include Disney Feature Animation, Pixar, Sony Pictures Imageworks, Weta Digital, Electronic Arts, Microsoft Game Studios, and many more.
